entry.summary: ...Gusty Wind Today... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...A northwest to north wind of 25 to 35 mph with gusts 45 to 50 mph. * WHERE...Northern Big Horn Basin.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 1:30AM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Snow and Gusty Wind Today... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Snow will develop around the morning commute. A gusty north wind of 20 to 30 mph will occur with the snow. Expect low visibility due to snow and blowing snow.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued January 13 at 5:20PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...BLOWING DUST HEALTH ALERT IN EFFECT FOR THE POWDER RIVER BASIN OF NORTHEASTERN WYOMING IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 3 PM MST FRIDAY... The following message is transmitted in collaboration with the Wyoming Department of Environmental Quality, Air Quality Division. * WHAT...Northwesterly winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts to over 50 mph. * WHERE...Powder River Basin of northeastern Wyoming.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 13 at 2:51PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: Wind gusts 45 to 55 MPH likely with a fast moving cold front Friday between 5 AM and 9 PM MST. The cold front will drop through north to south, so the wind gusts will begin across Converse, Niobrara, Sioux, and Dawes counties near 5 AM, spreading south to include all areas east of the Laramie Range and Interstate 25 by 9 AM, and continuing until around 9 PM.
